intro: Sebaea oligantha, commonly known as the silverleaf sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, waxy leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Sebaea oligantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
